data.title: Good food, small portions, high prices
data.text: We've lived in the neighborhood for about a year, and usually go to Sushi Machi on Military Trail for Japanese food (an outstanding restaurant in many ways). After driving past Kimura nearly every day, we decided to try it. Food was good: fresh, tasty and well-prepared; service was friendly and prompt. The portions were small, though, and prices were high, particularly compared to other places in the area. Most of the seating is at hibachi tables, with a la carte sushi composing the minority. Overall is was OK, but won't be back.

data.title: Blah Blah Blah
data.text:
Walked in @6pm weeknight / summer to fairly busy restaurant.
Opted for hibachi table to celebrate mothers b'day. Also. Let's w/ hostess of b'day girls seat and willing to pay, $5.00 to have drummers tables i.e. To sing and let mom hit the gong.
Positive: clean restaurant quick to take drink orders (no up sell of drinks)
Negative: OUR chef was not engaging of celebrating a b'day when we could hear chef at next table making a big deal of celebration . More than once I mentioned we were celebrating a birthday. To go boxes were handed out while we were still eating, beware when ordering waitress will confirm you want fried rice ( additional charge not mentioned at time of ordering) went for the show not the food so can't complain about the teriyaki chicken that had such a heavy salty sauce ( inedible)
Mgt took $5.00 off bill for no one eating the entree(chicken) nice!
Probably won't go back or recommend. Bill for 3 (entrees chicken , chicken & shrimp,filet & chicken 2 cokes $115.00
BTW Check the bill gratuity is included.(18%) wouldn't give much more based on no one came back to Che k on us.

data.title: disappointing all around
data.text: The service was brusque at best, from the hostess to the server.  They seemed to think they were doing us a favor to seat us, and wouldn't seat the first few people in a group of 5 until all 5 people had arrived.  The server never cracked a smile.  I ordered shrimp fried rice, and it was short on shrimp, with no vegetables other than tiny snippets of scallion or onion.  Very minimal and not worth the $12.95 I paid.  The taste was not offensive but nothing special.  My companions seemed to enjoy their sushi and other items.  I would not return here.  I would have rated it 2.5 but it's not possible to award half a circle.

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
We had the cook top dining which makes it amusing place to bring out of towners. 
It's all pretty standard food, good but not great. Instead of the steak we should have gotten the filet, the steak was extremely tough. The scallops had sand in them, not good. Chicken a d salmon were good. 
The cook was good it was more an issue with the food quality.

data.title: If you love hibachi!
data.text:
we went with family and friends to celebrate a birthday.  We always sit at the hibachi table because that is what everyone (except me) wants to eat.  Let me explain - the problem I have with hibachi is that your dinner is served in pieces:  first the rice, then the veggies and finally the protein.  By the time you get your meat/chicken/seafood, everything else is lukewarm.  Not my cup of tea but it seems to be everyone else's.

I took a chance and ordered off the 'kitchen' menu and had the Ton Katsu.  This is a thin pork cutlet dredged in panko and fried.  It was the BEST Katsu I have had in a long time.  As for the rest of party - they all loved their meals.  Served with a lot of flair and showmanship.  All was prepared to order, even those in the party who have shellfish allergies.

Pricing is fair for the amount of food served.  The steak was very tender and cooked perfectly.  

Perhaps next time I will try their sushi dishes.

So, if you like/love hibachi - go, you will not be disappointed.

data.title: My favorite restaurant ever!
data.text: We have eaten here over 15 times and always had a great meal and love watching our meal be prepared right in front of us.  Atmosphere is great.  Year ago my favorite was Benihana.  Kimura is way better and right here in my home town.  Awesome food and experience.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Terrible Experience
data.text: The worst hibachi I have ever had.  My lobster was burned and inedible.  The chef and server pretended not to notice.  The chef seemed like he had a date that he was late for.  Finally, they never cleared the table of dirty dishes even after we paid the check.  There are lots of better choices in the area.

data.title: Terrible Service
data.text: Went with the family for a night out. Had decent experience before, but service was terrible this time. Went without drinks for half the meal and we didn't even get our salads. When almost done with entree, waitress asked if we wanted to have our salads now since she only worked there for 2 weeks and somehow hasn't realized yet that she is supposed to bring them. I politely said no thank you and told her that she needed to just simply take it off our bill. Surprised when I got the bill and not only was it not adjusted, but 18% tip was already added! Talked to manager Sue who told me there was nothing she could do since I had already paid bill. Unfortunately, I will not be coming back...

data.title: Absolutely great!
data.text: The Hibachi food is great - whether you opt for shrimp, chicken or steak. The cooks are very attentive, fun and professional. I highly recommend this restaurant for family and friend dinners. Too noisy for business dinners. Attire is casual. Good prices.

data.title: A Hibachi surprise
data.text:
The last time I had a Hibachi dinner was in Bangkok at the Kobe Steak house in Siam Square, however that is so many years ago it was way before I started doing Travel Advisor reviews. But the memory lingered on and to find myself having a Hibachi meal in the USA was somewhat unique for me. I was not to be disappointed. The show put on by the chefs in preparing our food was a wonderful entertainment. Have you ever seen an egg split precisely into two as it descends from a toss into the air and is cut into two by the knife of the chef? There were ten people seated around the cooking area, and we all had different mains dishes I had salmon cooked exactly as I requested, seared not cooked through. Others had chicken and steak and prawns, a wonderful dinner, topped off by some very good fried rice for everyone around the cooker. Interestingly, our first visit only happened because we would have to wait 45 minutes at the adjacent Long Horn steak house, which we were not prepared to do, another good reason to dine before 6 PM.
I actually went back for a second dinner there, as we had enjoyed our meal so much but had a standard Japanese sushi dinner, I had a shrimp and veggie tempura and my friend a sashimi dinner.
 I really cannot cover the menu completely, however they have an excellent web site were the menu is available to see before going there.
Would I recommend the place, certainly.

data.title: Great hibachi
data.text: Went with grandsons and other relatives. Service great, food delicious. Our 8 year old grandsons love the show!

data.title: Fun, fantastic food!!!!
data.text:
Hibachi restaurants are fun (for most). I like the fresh food cooked right in front of you, and while I don't care for the huge initial flame, it comes with the territory. 

The food was absolutely delish. The salad dressing was phenomenal, more if a sesame dressing than a ginger dressing. The fresh fried rice was made with butter and to DIE for. They put a huge amount on my plate and I swore I would never finish it, but I did! The scallops were buttery and so fresh, the steak was fabulous. We had an exceptional meal at Kimura, I highly recommend it!

data.title: Great Japanese Restaurant
data.text: Went to this restaurant for the first time with friends. Very crowded as it was a weekend. We had reservations and didn't have a problem. Did the Hibachi experience and it was a fun show and the food was excellent. The portions were great. Went to a Benihana many years ago and got short changed on the servings. We had John do the cooking and he was a lot of fun. The steak melted in your mouth. I would definitely recommend trying this play. Very clean and the drinks were not watered down. Fun experience for the whole family!

data.title: so good
data.text: The best japanese ever. Every time we come back to Florida we have to enjoy this place and food. Plus the show is sooo funny for kids!

data.title: Funny and Good Food
data.text: I have to be honest I lived in South Florida all my life and have drove by this place millions of times going to the mall, or red lobster across the street. The outside looks a bit dated which is what kept me away for years, but this year the first time we went was on a double date. The people inside are great and majority of the chef's that cook in front of you are pretty damn funny. The best guy in my opinion he calls himself G-Unit.... They will keep you laughing the entire time. They all doing something special like taking a egg and rolling it down a spatula calling it Egg ROLL!!!!!!!!! And that's all the jokes i will say for now this is a place worth trying TRUST ME!!!!!!

data.title: JUST AMAZING
data.text: My first time at this restaurant and I am so impressed with their food, entertainment and the friendly personnel. Our Hibachi Chef was extraordinary and welcoming, we had such a great time with friends we have not seen in so long, and this place was just perfect for our reunion! Kimura Steak House became my favorite restaurant now :)

data.title: HIbachi or Japanese Steakhouse done well!
data.text:
Lets start by saying I read a lot of reviews before venturing here.
I did not request any special chef but luck would have us paired with 
"G Unit".
So first and foremost, I see these restaurants as both ENTERTAINMENT and FOOD. They should be graded on both counts.
Entertainment value is definitely there. This guy was funny but his humor was not for everyone. If you get offended easily, This chef is not for you. haha
I can see why so many prefer him after watching the chefs at the nearby tables do a standard textbook hibachi performance. That may be good for your first time but having been to these types of restaurants about 10+ times a year I am jaded and not  looking for the typical "Volcano" or "choo choo" onion.
Just off entertainment we would request his chef again.

Food comes next on this review and I will have to say it was OK. its not a steak that is going to blow you away (We had steak and rice dishes) but it was a meal you would not mind repeating. The price seems about on par with other restaurants of this sort and it was a great way to spend 1.5 hours on a Friday night.

If you are looking for amazing food, you can do better but you would be hard pressed to find a better deal for entertainment and eating all in one.

data.title: geart place
data.text: Again I want to review this place. We came in right on time and were seated at a table that was filled. (waiting on us). The waiter, Manuel, was excellent. Very attentive. my drink(coke) never emptied. Our cook (john) arrived with no fanfare at all. Since we had four kids at the table, I thought Oh no. But I was wrong. This guy was great. he played into the kids, and was a wonderful cook. I had the filet and chicken(again), and my wife had the shrimp and scallops. both were excellent. If you want hibachi, this is the place.

data.title: Hit or miss.....
data.text: The food is great but the portions are small and the prices are high. The service is fair but the tall blond hostess is RUDE. The bartender, Bonnie, is helpful but not very friendly but Jason is very friendly so I suggest you speak to him at the bar. Definitely ask for G-unit for your chef, he is the best!

data.title: What amazing experience every time
data.text:
We went to Kimura for the first time when we moved to town last year and became regulars.
We always try to get Chef G-UNIT (yes, that's his name) besides been a great cook is also a great comedian and would even sign for you!
